intro: Polylepis pauta, commonly known as the Pauta tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, rounded crown. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Polylepis pauta is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered an endangered species, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
